DOC.brief_summary: This study aim compare efficacy partial meal replacement diet conventional diet , induce weight loss improve metabolic inflammatory profile , endothelial function , erectile function , sexual desire , low urinary tract symptom ( LUTS ) , quality life obese men .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Diet-induced Weight Loss Obese Men
DOC.detailed_description: This study aim compare efficacy partial meal replacement diet conventional diet , induce weight loss , improve metabolic inflammatory profile , endothelial function , erectile function , sexual desire , low urinary tract symptom ( LUTS ) , quality life obese men . Men age 30-65 year , body mass index ( BMI ) â‰¥ 27.5 kg/m2 , recruit community Singapore . The study conduct Changi General Hospital train medical investigator , dietician sport trainer . At baseline 12 week , fast glucose lipid , insulin , testosterone , sex-hormone binding globulin , serum C-reactive protein interleukin-6 measure , endothelial function measure non-invasive EndoPAT method , validate questionnaire administer assess change erectile function , sexual desire , LUTS quality life
DOC.criteria: Male , age 3065 year Body Mass Index ( BMI ) > /= 27.5 kg/m2 Waist circumference ( WC ) > /= 90 cm pituitary disease cranial radiotherapy previous current androgen replacement deprivation therapy current treatment sexual problem LUTS glomerular filtration rate < 60 ml/min liver disease alcohol intake exceed 500 g/week previous 12 month use opiate , glucocorticoid , recreational drug phosphodiesterase inhibitor
